en.introPenname: I also go by the pen name
en.about:
Dedicated Computer Science student at the University of Puerto Rico Bayamon, with approximately <years> years of experience. 
 My journey began in high school, and I have actively participated in a video game research team, where we developed various games using different engines, which challenged us to learn new tools and adapt to diverse environments. 
 Additionally, I have engaged in several passion projects that have provided me with invaluable insights and hands-on experience in the software development process. I am committed to continuous learning and skill enhancement in my spare time, striving to maximize every opportunity for growth.
en.detailsBGMAPP:
Track player made using Electron and Vite, offers the functionality to play music tracks sourced from either a local directory or directly from online sources. 
 The track player is thoughtfully crafted with an intuitive user interface that has been strategically placed to effectively control and manage the player's state. While also containing various optimizations tricks thanks to virtualization and lazy loading. 
 These design were thoroughly crafted especially to contribute to a seamless user experience, allowing for effortless control and smooth navigation throughout the application.
en.descViewBGMAPP: BGMAPP allows the use of local music tracks by allowing the user to insert their own music track via any format the music track comes in.
en.titleShuffleBGMAPP: Never listen to the same old music again
en.descShuffleBGMAPP: BGMAPP is not whole without a shuffle functionally, which brings the essential of a music player to the application to randomize the music tracks.
en.descInputSearchBGMAPP: BGMAPP comes equipped with the functionality to search for any music track whenever the user wants to listen to their favorite tracks.
en.titleContextMenuBGMAPP: Play music at your own pace
en.descContextMenuBGMAPP: BGMAPP uses a context menu that allows the user to queue music track whichever way they prefer.
en.detailsL2DWP:
Interactable Live2D wallpaper made in Unity & Android Studio, which can contain various Live2D characters to interact with. 
 The game functions as a live wallpaper that allows users to interact with these characters by clicking on them, triggering various emotions and voice lines. While primarily designed to be used as an Android wallpaper, it is also compatible with desktops and WebGL platforms. Additionally, the Android version supports plugins that enable the utilization of native Android functions.
en.descCharacterIdleL2DWP: Can be integrated as an Android wallpaper that can be used as a customized live wallpaper.
en.descCharacterTalkL2DWP: Interacting with the Live2D character will activate various interactions such as movement and voice lines.
en.descCharacterUIL2DWP: L2DWP contains UI functionality that can be configured to interact with the android classes using Android Studio in Unity.
en.descNextCharacterTalkL2DWP: With the L2DWP any character that supports Live2D can be inserted into the wallpaper.
en.detailsSYMBIOMATA:
Asymmetrical VR coop platformer made in Unity, where the VR player is in charge of hand actions and the PC player is in charge of platforming. 
 The game features both local and online game modes. The latter of which is designed with a server-authoritative architecture using standard industry practices and features, such as client-side prediction for VR hand movement and projectile lag compensation, along with relay and lobbies for easy matchmaking. 
 Footage included was taken from real online gameplay.
en.titleSlashSYMBIOMATA: Transcend realities regardless of your physical distance
en.descSlashSYMBIOMATA: SYMBIOMATA can be played locally or online, giving you the ability to choose to play with someone on the same machine or with someone far away over the internet.
en.title2DSYMBIOMATA: Coordination is the key to success
en.desc2DSYMBIOMATA: Without the PC player, the VR player cannot avoid danger and without the VR player, the PC player cannot be protected from danger.
en.titleZiplineSYMBIOMATA: Find your way across various different stages
en.descZiplineSYMBIOMATA: SYMBIOMATA contains various stages with obstacles especially designed for PC and VR cooperation.
en.descVRPovSYMBIOMATA: SYMBIOMATA combines the ability to platform by allowing the PC player to control the movement of the character, and enabling the VR player to have full precision control over the virtual 3D space with the XR controllers.
en.detailsONIGIRI:
Souls-like singleplayer game made in Unity, where the player must defeat formidable bosses by parrying while also simultaneously evading their attacks. 
 The core mechanic revolves around precise timing, players must parry in sync with the rhythm of the enemy’s attacks. By correctly anticipating the attack, the player can successfully counter and retaliate against the enemy.
en.descBossONIGIRI: The attack pattern of the final boss, Gashadokuro’s AI, was designed to enhance the overall challenge and engagement of the game. Depending on if the player is either at long range or close range it will try to outmaneuver the player.
en.titleBossEntranceONIGIRI: Explore a fantasy world in one of the mountains of Japan with an eye-catching environment
en.descBossEntranceONIGIRI: Onigiri’s world is crafted with the goal to display as much detail as possible to display a fantasy feudal Japan.
en.titleBossParryONIGIRI: Let nothing stand in your way
en.descBossParryONIGIRI: Onigiri's combat mechanics revolve around executing precise parries of the enemy's attacks within a specific frame window to counter-hit the opponent to inflict damage.
en.titleMageONIGIRI: Dodge your way out of trouble
en.descMageONIGIRI: If a projectile is dodged at the correct time, the player will be rewarded, but if missed the player will get hit and lose hit points. Dodging was implemented for high-risk high-reward situations.
en.titleUnblockableONIGIRI: Waiting is the demon’s trump card
en.descUnblockableONIGIRI: Onigiri contains enemies with distinct attack patterns, necessitating a thoughtful and calculated approach from the player to overcome the obstacles.
en.detailsNEKOMATA:
Boss rush bullet hell game made in Unreal Engine 5, taking inspiration from the iconic top-down bullet hell Touhou series. 
 The core mechanic of the game is the rewind ability, which gives the player an ability to dodge enemies’ incoming projectiles, consequently returning the player to a previous probable vulnerable position. 
 The game features bosses with unavoidable projectiles to incentive constant use, while also maintaining an aspect of high risk/high reward.
en.descTutorialNEKOMATA: Nekomata features a simple basic tutorial that can teach players how to use the rewind ability and even teach the most basic techniques of classic games like Touhou.
en.titleBossFightNEKOMATA: Precise movement and good decision making
en.descBossFightNEKOMATA: The gameplay of Nekomata challenges the player into a battle of wits that with sufficient knowledge and skill, the player will be rewarded.
en.titleMinionFightNEKOMATA: Synchronized mice ballets form a destructive force
en.descMinionFightNEKOMATA: Using a very extensive and detailed audio system, the AI of the enemies are synched with the music for a full immersive gameplay effect.
en.descPlagueRatBossNEKOMATA: In Nekomata the player has to think fast to react or be destroyed in a barrage of non-stopping bullets.
en.detailsPORTFOLIO:
Portfolio website created entirely using React, Typescript, and Tailwind CSS, which serves as a showcase for a selection of projects that I have passionately created and worked on, marking a significant milestone in my development journey. 
 Each project presented reflects my skills and creativity, demonstrating a commitment to quality and usability. 
 Thank you for taking the time to explore my portfolio. Interest in my work is greatly appreciated, and I am eager to share my skills and projects. THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

es.about:
Estudiante apasionado a las Ciencias de Computadoras en la Universidad de Puerto Rico Bayamón, con aproximadamente 7 años de experiencia. 
 Mi viaje a esta ciencia empezó en escuela superior, y activamente he estado participando en un equipo de investigación de video juegos, en donde desarrollamos varios juegos con distintos engines de video juegos. 
 Adicionalmente, he hecho varios proyectos que me han apasionado y que me han aportado valiosa perspectiva y experiencia práctica en el proceso de desarrollo de software. Estoy comprometido con el aprendizaje continuo y la mejora de habilidades en mi tiempo libre, esforzándome por maximizar cada oportunidad de crecimiento.

ja.endPenname: と呼んでいただいてもいいです
